Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential harm of a photo of Trump having a stroke, stating that it will wipe out all information on the computer.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the existence of a virus that can wipe out all information on a computer.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a photo of Trump having a stroke is actually a virus, without providing any evidence or reasoning to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation, stating that scammers often use enticing headlines or fake photos to trick people into clicking on virus-infected links.
